questions.question: In the sentence. "The rescuers snatched the children from a perfect storm '; the underlined phrase means-
questions.explanation: The phrase "a perfect storm" originates from the title of Sebastian Junger's book and the subsequent movie adaptation, which tells the story of a confluence of meteorological events leading to a particularly intense storm. In common usage, it has come to represent a situation where several negative factors combine to create an extremely challenging or dangerous scenario. In the context of the sentence provided, "The rescuers snatched the children from a perfect storm," it implies that the situation from which the rescuers retrieved the children was one of extreme difficulty or danger, likely involving multiple hazardous factors coming together simultaneously. Thus, the phrase signifies "the worst situation" or an extremely challenging circumstance.
